channel.title: GitHub Assembly Monthly Trending
channel.description: Monthly Trending of Assembly in GitHub

item.title: chrislgarry/Apollo-11
item.description: Original Apollo 11 Guidance Computer (AGC) source code for the command and lunar modules.

item.title: Rangi42/polishedcrystal
item.description: An upgrade to Pokémon Crystal. Brings features and content up to date, and adds some original content.

item.title: apple/swift-nio-ssl
item.description: TLS Support for SwiftNIO, based on BoringSSL.

item.title: apple/swift-crypto
item.description: Open-source implementation of a substantial portion of the API of Apple CryptoKit suitable for use on Linux platforms.

item.title: BLAKE3-team/BLAKE3
item.description: the official Rust and C implementations of the BLAKE3 cryptographic hash function

item.title: below/HelloSilicon
item.description: An introduction to ARM64 assembly on Apple Silicon Macs

item.title: vxunderground/MalwareSourceCode
item.description: Collection of malware source code for a variety of platforms in an array of different programming languages.

item.title: netwide-assembler/nasm
item.description: A cross-platform x86 assembler with an Intel-like syntax

item.title: aws/aws-lc
item.description: AWS-LC is a general-purpose cryptographic library maintained by the AWS Cryptography team for AWS and their customers. It іs based on code from the Google BoringSSL project and the OpenSSL project.

item.title: giaf/blasfeo
item.description: Basic linear algebra subroutines for embedded optimization

item.title: openhwgroup/cva6
item.description: The CORE-V CVA6 is a highly configurable, 6-stage RISC-V core for both application and embedded applications. Application class configurations are capable of booting Linux.
